page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: There is only 1 "A" class road,the A5087,in the area and it passes along the eastern edge skirting the coast and is locally called the "Coast Road" It was built during the depression of the 1920's.A two-hourly bus service runs along this route connecting Barrow and Ulverston.Another two-hourly service links Barrow and Ulverston further inland via the villages of Leece and Gleaston.There is no railway line through the area. About 70% of the people travel to work in the nearby towns by private car.
